title: access permission is not revoked even if the email has been deleted or changed on the partner account -partners.shopify-

profile.name: Shopify
profile.about: Shopify is a multi-channel commerce platform that helps people sell online, in-store, and everywhere in between.

vulnerability_information:
I can get increased privileges from accounts that have been deleted from shopify partners.

a partner uses another business email account and when the business email has been replaced or deleted from a partner, it turns out that the account still has full access as a collaborator account or still has permission as a partner account.

## Steps For Reproductions
1. create a partner account and use another business account email, and confirm
2. Add the store as a collaboration, and receive permission from the shop owner
3. Open a shop that has given permission
4. Return to partners, change business email to your email, and confirm
5. open an account from the email that has been used in a business email (step 1), try logging in to the added store (step 2). You can not enter and look email is not registered at the store
6. try logging in to `accounts.shopify.com` and successfully entering the shopify account
7. entered the store that was added, after successfully logging in it turns out that this account entered using the name of the partner account ██████████

## Impact

The account can enter the collaboration store using the permission as a collaboration account even though it has been deleted from the partner account and is not part of the partner
vulnerability_information_html:
I can get increased privileges from accounts that have been deleted from shopify partners.

a partner uses another business email account and when the business email has been replaced or deleted from a partner, it turns out that the account still has full access as a collaborator account or still has permission as a partner account.

Steps For Reproductions

  1. create a partner account and use another business account email, and confirm
  2. Add the store as a collaboration, and receive permission from the shop owner
  3. Open a shop that has given permission
  4. Return to partners, change business email to your email, and confirm
  5. open an account from the email that has been used in a business email (step 1), try logging in to the added store (step 2). You can not enter and look email is not registered at the store
  6. try logging in to accounts.shopify.com and successfully entering the shopify account
  7. entered the store that was added, after successfully logging in it turns out that this account entered using the name of the partner account ██████████

Impact

The account can enter the collaboration store using the permission as a collaboration account even though it has been deleted from the partner account and is not part of the partner

activities.message: if 2 accounts share 1 business email and have changed business email because it is deemed incompatible with the relationship of the 2 account owners and has split, then both parties can still see the collaboration shop. and the shop owner doesn't know it happened.
activities.markdown_message: if 2 accounts share 1 business email and have changed business email because it is deemed incompatible with the relationship of the 2 account owners and has split, then both parties can still see the collaboration shop. and the shop owner doesn't know it happened.

activities.message:
I want to ask, @shopify-peteryaworski  and  @jenn-shopify 

if the impact of the above method can also affect the "developer store" in a partner account, can it also be reported?

because I tried to do the same method on the "developer store" and it turns out that access is allowed even though it has been deleted from the partner account, and both accounts can `fight over`  the "developer store"  by metode transferring ownership.

in other words, 1 store can be forcibly taken over by one of the account owners by making the staff in the shop become the owner. so access to developer store at one of the accounts is lost!

thankz
activities.markdown_message:
I want to ask, @shopify-peteryaworski and @jenn-shopify

if the impact of the above method can also affect the "developer store" in a partner account, can it also be reported?

because I tried to do the same method on the "developer store" and it turns out that access is allowed even though it has been deleted from the partner account, and both accounts can fight over the "developer store" by metode transferring ownership.

in other words, 1 store can be forcibly taken over by one of the account owners by making the staff in the shop become the owner. so access to developer store at one of the accounts is lost!

thankz

activities.message:
I found a 2 new impact:
(1). store name leak on partner account, see ███████
actually the `jaka205` store is created using a different business email (█████████+205 and not █████████+201) but the ███+201 account can see the store name created by the partner account (former the friend partner account)

in other words is
##information leaks name the store created even though the two partner accounts have been split

even those partner accounts have been separated since I made this report (05-10-2020)

and (2). The account can still get access permission using the name of the partner account or collaborator account even after changing the email address
activities.markdown_message:
I found a 2 new impact:
(1). store name leak on partner account, see ███████
actually the jaka205 store is created using a different business email (█████████+205 and not █████████+201) but the ███+201 account can see the store name created by the partner account (former the friend partner account)

in other words is

information leaks name the store created even though the two partner accounts have been split

even those partner accounts have been separated since I made this report (05-10-2020)

and (2). The account can still get access permission using the name of the partner account or collaborator account even after changing the email address

activities.message: for number (2), see █████

activities.message:
Hi @████,
Thanks for the additional info! This may be a separate issue, as it involves the step of transferring ownership (which was not part of the original report):

> because I tried to do the same method on the "developer store" and it turns out that access is allowed even though it has been deleted from the partner account, and both accounts can fight over the "developer store" by metode transferring ownership.
in other words, 1 store can be forcibly taken over by one of the account owners by making the staff in the shop become the owner. so access to developer store at one of the accounts is lost!

If you believe this behaviour has security implications, can you please open a separate report for this issue with full steps to reproduce?
Thanks!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @████,
Thanks for the additional info! This may be a separate issue, as it involves the step of transferring ownership (which was not part of the original report):

because I tried to do the same method on the "developer store" and it turns out that access is allowed even though it has been deleted from the partner account, and both accounts can fight over the "developer store" by metode transferring ownership.
in other words, 1 store can be forcibly taken over by one of the account owners by making the staff in the shop become the owner. so access to developer store at one of the accounts is lost!

If you believe this behaviour has security implications, can you please open a separate report for this issue with full steps to reproduce?
Thanks!

activities.message:
Thanks again for your report. We're awarding a $1,000 bounty for this issue. We placed this near the low end of our bounty payout range due to the fact that an attacker would need to be in a position of high trust to exploit this issue, since they would need to control the business email of a partner, and a merchant would need to accept that partner's request to access their store.

We'll be in touch again once the issue is resolved.
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks again for your report. We're awarding a $1,000 bounty for this issue. We placed this near the low end of our bounty payout range due to the fact that an attacker would need to be in a position of high trust to exploit this issue, since they would need to control the business email of a partner, and a merchant would need to accept that partner's request to access their store.

We'll be in touch again once the issue is resolved.
